column5: whats biting in and around markham?
Not much fishing to be done in Markham.  Toogood Pond in Unionville has some fish, but I wouldn't want to fish it.  You've got a better chance of getting some ripe cougar at Jake's on Main Pub  Joey

Hey CH, Ya got the upper rouge that runs right through. The rainbow season should be in full swing in the upper stretches just below milne dam.If ya want some good access points I'll PM ya some spots.   FHR

Just to be clear, the season for rainbow hasn't opened there yet.  There should still be some there when it does.  Toogood and the Milne pond have large mouth, carp, and pan fish.  The Rouge gets runs of Rainbows and Browns along with Chinook.
try the milne dam!! (mccown and hwy 7)last year sometimes around late april i  caught a 15 LBS Carp!!
thanks everyone!!! I will be there every few weeks now that the M.O.L has moved back there...  Joey, I have retired on the Cougars after I mounted a few in College
Hmmmmmmm, cougars.
YOU! went to collage?
LSC in june through Dec come on down we got a seat open  for you
sure did.. 3 years in a 2 year program!  Mr Eh, that would eb awesome, St Clair has been on my list for a long time ( i got the K K's!)
Not open till May 22nd though

Trout season opens the last Saturday in April.  The last few years the Metro East Anglers club stocked 5000 dinner sized trout for the kiddies to enjoy at Milne on the opener - No news yet for this year though.
at warden and steeles you can catch bass, bullheads, and even snakeheads. I think the place is called the T&T. check it out sometime.

I didn't mean fish wasn't open I mean I have read on all the Town of Markham websites that Milne Damn Park at McCowan and 7 is not at all open until May 22nd, so I have been stearing clear.  Am I wrong??  It's sooooo close to my house I could walk for crying out load.  I'll try and give the Town of Markham a call today and see what's up.

This is what I could find  "Fishing is allowed with a MNR fishing permit (available at bait shops and Canadian Tire stores). The park is open for vehicles from 8:00 am until dusk from Victoria Day weekend until Thanksgiving. Admission to the park is free during the week"  To me, it leaves room for interpretation.  It states that it's open for vehicular access starting May 22 but really doesn't state that you couldn't fish prior to that - If you are in walking distance, there's nothing really there to say you can't walk in.  This is actually my first time reading that.  My dad and I never had problems driving in over the years nor has anyone else that I know around this time (before Victoria weekend) - Then again the gate was always open.  Last year around this time the park was open for joggers, dog-walkers, bird-watchers and other day-users.  It was also posted on the internet last year the week before the trout opener to come and catch the stocked rainbow trout on the last Saturday in April.  Maybe fellow OFNer Wolfville might know more.  Last year he worked with the city to change that misleading sign at the TooGood pond entrance by the dam.  You can always call the city before you head out to ensure that you aren't trespassing.
Ok just called the town.  My mistake Milne is open just the park facilities and the parking lot at McCowan and 7.  She said the best entrance is behind the KFC near Markham Road on 7.  Shortest walk.
Now that's funny stuff Joey  Now where is this place at  Whopper
If cougars is what you are fishing for hehe you are better off fishing in Rocky Mountain High!!
Craz, what does your M.I.L. have to do with it? Are you using her as chum?
I've lived in Markham for 25 years CH.  If you're in the area shoot me a PM and I can show you about a dozen different places to fish.
What should I use live bait? Spinners? Plastics? Crankbaits and what color?       Sorry couldn't resist
haha Whopper I think ya know my posts well enough, that maybe I should answer that on the other board hahaha
So I have never fished trout before, never even seen in done....ya ya haha.....any tips for trout fishing at Milne Dam would be helpful.  I would like the take the kids this week.
